em.span: Our Vision is to provide a safe and caring environment in which our students can develop academically, creatively, and socially. Each member of the school community will demonstrate personal integrity, a commitment to learning, and an appreciation for cultural diversity.

div.a: Letter from the RCS Phys Ed Department

a.span: Follow this link to read a letter from the RCS Phys Ed Department regarding at-home physical education requirements.

span.span: Dear Parents/Students and Roxbury School Community,

p.span: The School Building Closure will continue through April 29th with the school building reopening on April 30th.
Regents’ exams schedule for June are cancelled.
8th and 9th grade students will be exempt from the Algebra I Regents and Living Environment Regents.
10th grade students taking Global, Geometry, Earth Science will not have to retake the exams and are exempt.

11th grade students who were supposed to take the ELA, US History, Chemistry, Algebra II Regents’ exam are exempt and can graduate. Additionally, students pursuing their Advanced designation can still qualify for the degree without taking the Algebra II Regents exam. Students must still earn the 3 required credits for LOTE but do not have to take the local checkpoint exam. Accelerated students are also exempt from the Regents exams requirements and can still be accelerated.
Students are not required to take the regents exams (if they are offered) in August 2020, unless they want too.
Lab minute requirements for science courses are also exempt for course credit.
For courses who use the Regents Exam as their final exam they will need to administer a locally developed exam to substitute.

Students will receive course credit if their final average is passing according to school regulation. However, keep in mind that if a student does not pass a course that ends in a Regents exam and needs to retake the course or do credit recovery, the student would still be exempt from the Regents Exam and would only be retaking the course to earn credit.
Just a reminder that meal delivery will be Monday and Thursday until the end of the closure.
We are just a phone call away to support you and your child. Please reach out to us.

span.span: Notice is hereby given that the annual Meeting and Budget Vote typically held each year on the third Tuesday in May is hereby postponed until at least June 1, 2020, and the circulation, filing, and collection of petitions for Board of Education positions are postponed pursuant to the New York State Governor’s Executive Order 202.13. Further notice will be given when more information is available.

As you are all aware, we will be "in session" during the scheduled Spring Break, April 6-10. The RCS staff and administration have developed a required school-wide project to be completed by your children during this time. This assignment is by household,
so one project per family.

You are creating a memory with your family to de-stress during this time in our history. What have you learned during this event? Share your family's experience in a creative, fun way! Remember, we're all in this together!
Click the link below to download the Project Sheet with the required guidelines, due date and suggestions for relaxing with your family and sharing your creativity. C'mon, RCS! Show us what you got!

a.span: Follow this link for resources for parents on anxiety, COVID-19, motivation, mindfulness and fun activities!

strong.span: Please use the Lower Level as your entry point
school events as it will be the only entrance open.
Website accessibility information for those with disabilities.
